alert.note: Alert for Colusa; Glenn (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 2:43PM PDT until further notice by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy rain over the last several hours has caused minor flooding across portions of the northern Sacramento Valley and adjacent foothills. We are getting reports of roadway flooding on Whitmore Road east of Redding and Flores Ave offramp from I-5 south of Red Bluff. We are also see significant rises on local streams and creeks such as Cow Creek and Cottonwood Creek. Additional light to moderate rainfall will continue across this area into the evening, continuing to bring minor flooding impacts along with rises on local streams and creeks. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Butte, Colusa, Glenn, Plumas, Shasta, Sierra, Tehama and Yuba. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Rises on rivers and streams. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 231 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redding, Chico, Paradise, Oroville, Red Bluff, Corning, Orland, Willows, Palo Cedro, Shingletown, Elk Creek, Mineral, Shasta Dam, Alder Springs, Pulga, Maxwell, Yolla Bolly District Rs, Palermo, Brush Creek Rs and Glenn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
